name: Martin Grimeland
title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER, CTO FOR-HIRE, CLEAN CODE EVANGELIST
pitch: Martin has a master’s degree in Computer Science and MBA courses at Boston University. He has more than 12 years of experience in software development in 5 different countries. For most of Martin’s career he has had leadership positions, usually also with responsibilities as lead architect. In these positions Martin has gained lots of experience building and putting together teams, developing products from scratch and contributing to setting business and product strategies. Martin has always been drawn towards working with Startups and has worked in 5 different startups since his first job in 2006. In 2014 Martin joined Kahoot! as Head of Engineering and was one of the first to join the company. Martin played an important part in shaping the company and besides growing the engineering team across multiple disciplines and distributed over 3 continents he took lead on establishing Kahoot!'s office in Austin and regularly attended conferences with the founders to drive engagement. Kahoot! gained global traction and during Martin's time grew to 50 million monthly active users all over the world.

Since early on in his career Martin has worked in leadership positions and played a central role in developing the business and the product strategies in the companies he has worked in. This has given him a lot of experience with what needs to be considered when developing these strategies and insight in what works and what doesn’t.

Martin has been fortunate enough to build many great teams, both big and small and across different disciplines, even beyond engineering. It’s important to get the right people and understand how to help a team work to it's full potential. Martin has worked a lot on streamlining processes and workflows to increase the teams’ efficiency and improve the quality of the product. He has designed and planned a professional development program and done one-to-one mentoring to help people further develop their skills.

As team lead and chief architect on many different products Martin has designed entire systems from the infrastructure to the software architecture and implemented the systems from scratch. Throughout this work Martin has gained extensive knowledge and experience on how to translate requirements to a complete system.
experience: Extensive experience in Startups designing and contributing to business strategies
Scaling, tuning and managing engineering teams.
Strong interest and focus on Clean Code and Lean Principles.
Works focused with excellent analytical skills and great in teams.

name: Amy Vidler
title: PRODUCT DESIGNER AND LEAD UX DESIGNER FOR HIRE
pitch: Amy has worked as a designer within the graphic, product and web fields since 2005. The majority of her work experience has been with creating user-friendly applications.

Disciplines in which Amy work on a regular basis include interaction design, visual design, usability, user research, responsive web design and information architecture. She has a good understanding of HTML, CSS and some Javascript. Amy enjoys working in multidisciplinary teams, developing design guidelines, leadership and project management.

Amy's professional interest lies in a combination of user experience design, product development and management to create web-based products and services that are beautiful, useful and driven by user-centred business development principles.

education.authority: Queensland College of Art, Griffith University
education.degree: BA, Design; Product and Graphic major

education.authority: Queensland College of Art, Griffith University

expertise: User centred design for web and native platforms.
Product concept and user behaviour testing/research.
Interaction design, visual design and usability.
Visual and interaction product portfolio guidelines.
experience: Facilitating and laying down ground work for maturing ideas.
Ensuring a recognisable experience across a product portfolio.
